guide.title: Accessing Couchbase Server views via Sync Gateway
guide.description: A guide to accessing views on Couchbase Server via Sync Gateway.

introduction.paragraph: Sync Gateway has a feature that allows clients to directly query Couchbase Views via the SYnc Gateay REST API.

article.title: Creating and querying a View
article.description: This article walks you through on how to define a view using the TodoLite sample app. There are a few special considerations when defining a view against a bucket used by Sync Gateway.

introduction.paragraph: After walking through these steps, you will have a Couchbase View defined and have issued queries against it on both the Admin (4985) and User (4984) ports.

body.paragraph: Now we will access the Couchbase View created in the previous article via the Sync Gateway amdin port (4985). The Admin port is easier to test on, because there are no access control restrictions or user auth to worry about.

Query the view via curl: curl localhost:4985/todolite/_design/all_lists/_view/all_lists

topic.title: Tesing the view via the User port

body.paragraph: Views are also available via the User port (4984), and will automatically filter the returned data to the subset of the data which the user has access to.

list-item.paragraph: Find out your user id curl localhost:4985/todolite/_user/ and look for your facebook ID. If you don't know your facebook ID, you can login to developer.facebook.com to find it.
Create a new session token via curl -X POST -H "Content-type: application/json" -d '{"name": "your-user-id"}' localhost:4985/todolite/_session
The response will look like this: {"session_id":"03bdd7f1be83f035a7298924f9a28270feac7f4c","expires":"2015-03-17T21:39:16.076186179Z","cookie_name":"SyncGatewaySession"}
Query the view on port 4984 via curl --cookie "SyncGatewaySession=03bdd7f1be83f035a7298924f9a28270feac7f4c" localhost:4984/todolite/_design/all_lists/_view/all_lists
